metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3933 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow could occur when OpenEXR processes a crafted file on systems where size_t < 64 bits. This could cause an invalid bytesPerLine and maxBytesPerLine value, which could lead to problems with application stability or lead to other attack paths.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr-3-1-30 - 3.1.5-4
openexr - 3.1.5-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.5-4').
povray package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
